segment.description: Message Header - The MSH (Message Header) segment defines the characteristics of the message. The sending and receiving applications are identified, as well as the encoding characters used as delimiters for the message. The MSH message type is used to indicate the type of message being transmitted. In the MSH of the ACK response, the values of the Sending Application, Sending Facility, Receiving Application, and Receiving Facility are the reverse of the values in the original message. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the MSH segment include: OFP - Outbound Field Processing

field.description: Encoding characters
Sending application - Site- Application defined description of sending application. Must be unique. Configurable in HL7 User Table 0361.
Sending facility - Site- Facility defined description of sending facility. Configurable in ESO_INIT_OUTBOUND. HL7 User Table 0362.
Receiving application - Site- defined description of receiving application. Configurable in ESO_INIT_OUTBOUND. HL7 User Table 0361.
Receiving facility - Site- defined description of receiving facility. Configurable in ESO_INIT_OUTBOUND. HL7 User Table 0362.
Date/Time of message - System date and time the message was formatted in sending system. This was made required in HL7 version 2.4.
Security - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Message type - type and event triggering the message.Specific HL7 message

Message control ID - Unique, initiator generated. Responder returns sender value in ACK message in MSA-2. With acknowledg messages, MSH-10 value may be identical to original sender value or may be a new unique value assigned by acknowledg system. Note: The Control ID will consist of at least the QUEUE_ID and TRIGGER_ID of the transaction. The QUEUE_ID immediately follows the Q. The TRIGGER_ID immediately follows the T.

Processing ID - In HL7 version 2.3.1, This value is derived from CCL. The suggested values are A - Archive , R - Restore from archive, I - Initial load, not present for Not present and T - Current processing or transmitted at intervals
Version ID - HL7 version. Set to 2.3, 2.4, or 2.5.1 as appropriate.
Sequence number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 sequence number protocol.
Continuation pointer - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Value indicating a single logical message transmitted using more than one physical message.
Accept acknowledgment type - The default is AL.
Application acknowledgment type - The default is NE.
Country code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Country of origin for international format and default options. HL7 recommends codes from ISO 3166. HL7 User table 0399
Character set - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 Table 0211.
Principal language of message - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Codes from ISO 639.
Alternate character set handling scheme - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User table 0356.
Message Profile Identifier - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

segment.description: Message Acknowledgment - The MSA (Message Acknowledgment) segment is returned as part of MSH, MSA pair in the ACK message type. The MSA segment also is returned in response messages to an original mode or enhanced mode query.

field.description: Acknowledgment code - Valid values: AA = ACK = message stored AE = ACK = message stored with error noted AR = NAK =message rejected. HL7 User Table 0008
Message control ID - Echo MSH segment control ID (MSH-10) of message being acknowledged
Text message
Expected sequence number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Delayed acknowledgment type - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Error condition - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0357. Error codes: 204 Unknown key identifier, 205 - Duplicate key identifier, and 207 - application internal error.

segment.description: Patient Identification - The PID segment identifies the person and usually the encounter associated with the message. Patient demographic information is also provided. Cerner Millennium requires at least one primary Patient or Person Identifier. Cerner Millennium associates one person alias of MRN type with each encounter. By default, the interface sends all identifiers and provide identifier type and source as described in the PID segment. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the PID segment are AD - ADDRESS, EN - ENCOUNTER, EA - ENCNTR_ALIAS, P - PERSON, PA - PERSON_ALIAS, PP - PERSON_PATIENT, PH - PHONE, and PN - PERSON_NAME.

field.description: Set ID - PID - Start at 1, increment by 1.
Patient ID - ESO will value with alias of MRN type associated with this encounter. Not valued for person level events.

Patient identifier list - In HL7 version 2.3, the list of all person aliases of MRN or CMRN type for HL7 version 2.3. This is a repeating field. In HL7 version 2.3.1, the ENCTR_MRN alias is in the first occurrence while all unique types will follow

Alternate patient ID - PID - In HL7 version 2.3, other person aliases whose type is not MRN or CMRN. Other possible types include NHIN - National Health Insurance Number, SHIN - State/ Province Health Insurance Number, MILITARYID, PASSPORT, HNAPERSONID - HNA Classic patient sys id from feeder Millennium system. In HL7 version 2.3.1, this type of information is now be supported in PID-3.

Patient name - The interface sends the NAME from the PERSON_NAME table whose type is CURRENT in the first occurrence then alternate names, using standard HL7 format. Last^First^middle^suffix^prefix^degree^type. Note: All names on name table have a name type code. Cerner Millennium valid name type code meanings include ADOPTED, ALTERNATE, CURRENT, LEGAL, MAIDEN, OTHER, PREVIOUS, PREFERRED. When the current name changes, the new name becomes the new CURRENT name and the old current name is retained as the previous name. HL7 2.3 Table 0200. HL7 name type codes: L - legal, M - maiden, C - adopted, and A - alias.
Mother maiden name - Treated as a person attribute and not as an alias. See PID-5 for layout.
Date/time of birth
Sex - Valid values M, F, or U. Default is U. HL7 Table 0001.

Patient alias - In HL7 version 2.3, with the exception of CURRENT, the interface sends a list of all other name types. See PID-5 for layout. HL7 User table 0200. In HL7 version 2.4, this type of information is supported in PID-5. HL7 User table 0200.
Race - HL7 User table 0005
Patient address- Multiple instances will be provided. The number of instances captured in Cerner Millennium may vary by application. The interface itself has no limit to the number of instances
Patient address - Not supported by Cerner Millennium, instead use PID-11.9. HL7 User table 0289.
Phone number - home - Cerner Millennium type HOME.
Cerner Millennium type BUSINESS. See PID-13 for layout.
Primary language
Marital status
Religion - Examples are Baptist, Catholic, Methodist, and so on
Patient account number - Financial/ Billing Number.
SSN number - patient - In HL7 version 2.3, the Person alias type code is SSN. In HL7 version 2.3.1, this type of information is supported in PID-3.

Driver license number - patient - In HL7 version 2.3, the Person alias type code is DRLIC.
In HL7 version 2.5, this type of information is supported in PID-3.
Mother identifier - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Ethnic group - Further defines the patient ancestry. HL7 User table 0189.
Birth place - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Multiple birth indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User table 0136.
Birth order - Number indicating birth order.
Citizenship - Currently, Cerner Millennium will use one instance. HL7 User table 0171
Veterans military status - HL7 User table 0172
Nationality - HL7 User table 0212
Patient death date and time
Patient death indicator - HL7 User table 0136.
Identity Unknown Indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User table 0136.
Identity Reliability Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium HL7 User Table 0445.
Last Update Date/Time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Last Update Facility - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Species Code - HL7 User Table 0446.
Breed Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7
Strain - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Production Class Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0429.
Tribal Citizenship - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0171.

segment.description: Notes and Comments - The NTE segment is used for sending textual notes and comments for information transmitted in other segments. The comment applies to the segment preceding the NTE segment. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the NTE segment are CENT - CE_EVENT_NOTE, LBLOB - LONG_BLOB, LONG - LONG_TEXT, and OCOM-ORDER_COMMENT.

field.description: Set ID-NTE - Sequential. Start at 1 and increment by 1 for each set (order, result).

Source of comment - In HL7 2.3 processing Cerner Millennium uses Code Set 14 to send the Comment type. The interface sends a code value whose CDF meaning is MISSINGATTCH to indicate the transmitted document has an attachment in Millennium that cannot be sent. In HL7 version 2.3.1 and forward this field will use Code Set 13 as the Source of Comment. HL7 User Table 0105.

Comment - Each \.br\ represents a hard carriage return. 32k When an attachment is missing or exceeds the designated size limit, the interface includes error text and the value of EVENT_TITLE_TEXT from CE_EVENT_NOTE table, plus the text "can be viewed in source interface"
Comment type - In HL7 2.3.1, the interface populates this field with a code value whose CDF Meaning is MISSINGATTACH. HL7 User Table 0364

segment.description: Patient Visit - The PV1 segment provides visit- or encounter-specific information. This is an optional segment. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the PV1 segment are BED - BED, EA - ENCNTR_ALIAS, ED - ENCNTR_DOMAIN, ELH - ENCNTR_LOC_HIST, EN - ENCOUNTER, EPRLR - ENCNTR_PRSNL_RELTN, PRL - PERSNL, and PRLA - PERSNL_ALIAS.

field.description: Set ID - PV1 - Start at 1, Increment by 1
Patient class - HL7 User Table 0004.
Current patient location. Cerner Millennium location is hierarchical. Facility^building^point of service location^room^bed.
Admission type - HL7 User Table 0007.
Preadmit number - Encounter alias of type HNAENCNBR. Applies only to interfaces involving a Cerner Millennium platform.
Prior patient location - Only provided for ADT A03 transfer messages.

Attending doctor - Code meaning ATTEND for doctor relationship for this patient visit. Currently, Cerner Millennium allows only one active relationship of this type. HL7 User Table 0010. - From Cerner Millennium: By default, the interface sends a list of all available alias types for this provider (such as UPIN, DOCNBR, USERID). The interface provides a common routine available from a com client script to filter the alias list. If the code value outbound alias value for the alias pool code (Code Set 263) is set of DONOTSEND, the personnel alias will be deleted from the list.

Referring doctor - The code meaning REFERDOC for doctor relationship for this patient visit. Currently, Cerner Millennium allows only one active relationship of this type. See PV1-7, HL7 User Table 0010. In HL7 version 2.5, the degree is sent in PV1.21 Professional Suffix.
Consulting doctor - Code meaning CONSULTDOC for this visit See PV1-7 HL7 User Table 00100. In HL7 version 2.5, the degree is sent in PV1-9.21 Professional Suffix.
Consulting doctor - Required field by HL7 with trigger events A01, A02, A14,Document generated by Confluence on Dec 31, 2009 11:09 Page 74 and A15. HL7 User Table 0069.
Temporary location - Do not send unless patient will be appropriately and timely removed from the temporary location. Location type TEMP.
Preadmit test indicator - Pre- admit testing required before admission. HL7 User Table 0087.
Re-admission indicator - Patient is readmit or recurring visit. HL7 User Table 0092.
Admit source - HL7 User Table 0023.
Ambulatory status - Cerner Millennium uses only one instance. HL7 User Table 0009.
VIP indicator - Indicates this person or encounter may need to be treated with special consideration during this visit. HL7 User Table 0099.

Admitting doctor - Code meaning ADMITDOC for doctor relationship for this visit. Cerner Millennium allows only one active relationship of this type. HL7 User Table 0010. In HL7 version 2.5, the degree is sent in PV1-17.21 Professional Suffix.
Patient type - Categorize patient populations to groups more specific than patient class. Millennium uses to define patient encounter processing options. HL7 User Table 0018.
Visit number - Encounter alias of type VISITID.
Financial class - Primary class assigned to patient for purpose of identifying sources of reimbursements. Cerner Millennium will use only one instance. Effective date not valued. HL7 User Table 0064.
Financial class - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0032.
Courtesy code - Special considerations for this patient such as express discharge. HL7 User Table 0045.
Credit rating - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0046
Contract code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0044.
Contract effective date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Contract amount - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Contract period - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Interest code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Transfer to bad debt code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Transfer to bad debt date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Bad debt agency code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Bad debt transfer amount - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Bad debt recovery amount - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Delete account indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Delete account date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Discharge disposition - HL7 User table 0112.
Discharged to location - HL7 User table 0113.
Diet type - Indicates patient is on a special diet, HL7 User table 0114
Servicing facility - Cerner Millennium uses PV1-3. HL7 User Table 0115.
Bed status - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0116.
Account status - Code meanings include TEMP, PRELIM, ACTIVE, CANCELLED, COMPLETE, BILLED, PURGE, PREADMIT. HL7 User Table 0117.
Pending location - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Prior temporary location - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Admit date/time - Time registration or admission was performed. Cerner Millennium requires for A01 and A04 and any other event used to create new encounter row.

Discharge date/time - Actual time patient was discharged from facility. Patient types that do not always receive a discharge or other event to close an encounter must be defined in Cerner Millennium to auto- discharge
Current patient balance - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Total charges - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Total adjustments - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Total payments - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Alternate visit ID - Encounter alias with alias type OTHER.
Visit indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Specifies level on which data is sent. HL7 values are A - Account and V - Visit. HL7 User Table 0326.
Other healthcare provider - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Used for other healthcare providers, such as nurse practitioner, midwife, physician assistant. HL7 User Table 0010.

segment.description: Patient Additional Demographic - The PD1 patient demographic segment contains demographic information that is likely to change about the patient. The PD1 segment is optional and follows the PID segment in any ADT message for any ADT event trigger code. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from or related to the PD1 segment include EPRLR - ENCNTR_PRSNL_RELTN, O - ORGANIZATION, POR - PERSON_ORGANIZATION_RELTN, PP - PERSON_PATIENT, PPRLR - PERSON_PRSNL_RELTN, and P - PERSON.

field.description: Living dependency - HL7 User Table 0223. Living conditions relevant to health care needs, such as medical supervision required, small children dependent.
Living arrangement - HL7 User Table 0220. Situation in which patient lives at residential address, such as alone, family, institution.

Patient primary facility - name(ST)^name type (ID)^org code (ID)^check digit^check type^assign authority(HD)^type^facility - The patient's primary care facility defined as the REGPRACTICE on the PERSON_ORGANIZATION_REL table. The organization_id is provided to allow custom scripting to extract the appropriate organization alias.
Patient primary care provider name and ID number - Primary Care Provider selected by patient. Code meaning PCP for this person.
Student indicator - HL7 User Table 0231. Indicates if the person is a full- or part- time student. Does not indicate degree or field of study
Handicap - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Permanent handicapped condition. HL7 User Table 295
Living will - Indicates whether the person has a living will and if a copy is on file at the healthcare facility. HL7 User Table 315
Organ Donor - Indicates whether the person wants to donate their organs and whether an organ card is on file with the healthcare facility. HL7 User Table 316.
Separate bill - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Bill patient rather than guarantor. HL7 User Table 136.
Separate bill - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Informational only. No action required by receiver.

Publicity code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0215. Level of publicity at the patient level (for example, No publicity, Family Only). Cerner Millennium identifies a level of security that may restrict access or release of information. HL7 user table 0215.

Protection indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 Y/ N Table 136. Keep information from users who do not have adequate security. Patient Level HL7 user table 0136Future functionality: Table: P Attribute: confid_level_cd CS: 87
Protection Indicator effective date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Place of worship - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Advance directive code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 user table 0435.
Immunization registry status - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 user table 0441.
Immunization registry status effective date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Publicity code effective date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Military Branch - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Military Rank/ Grade - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Military Status - Not supported by Cerner Millennium

segment.description: Common Order - The ORC segment is used to transmit fields that are common to all orders and services requested. The ORC segment is optional in the Order (ORU) message. In HL7 version 2.3, the routine argument to turn on the ORC segment is Send_ORC. The interface includes the ORC with combined results primarily as a placeholder to provide the order control code. The interface also provides an option to send the ORC based on result type. For event- and order-level charts, PowerNote results, and MDOC (Documents), the ORC segment is sent by default. In HL7 version 2.3.1 and subsequent versions there is no routine argument. See sections above for information as to which fields are populated.

field.description: Order control - In HL7 version 2.3, CN or RE.
Placer order number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Filler order number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Placer group number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Order status - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Response flag - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Quantity/timing - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Parent - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Date/time of transaction - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Entered by - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Verified by - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Ordering provider - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Enterer location - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Call back phone number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Order effective date/time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Order control code reason - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Entering organization - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Entering device - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Action by - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Advanced beneficiary notice code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Ordering facility name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Ordering facility address - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Ordering facility phone number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Ordering provider address - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Order Status Modifier - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Advanced Beneficiary Notice Override Reason - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Filler's Expected Availability Date/Time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Confidentiality Code- Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Order Type- Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Enterer Authorization Mode- Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

segment.description: Observation Request - In the reporting of clinical data, the OBR serves as the report header. It acts as the summary for the observation; the details of the observation are carried in the OBX segments that follow. The OBR segment includes the relevant ordering information when that applies. It contains many of the attributes that usually apply to all of the included observations. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the OBR segment are CE - CLINICAL_EVENT, CEPRL - CE_EVENT_PRSNL, CENT - CE_EVENT_NOTE, CEMB - CE_MICROBIOLOGY, O - ORDERS, OAC - ORDER_ACTION, OAL - ORDER_ALIAS, OCOM - ORDER_COMMENT, OD - ORDER_DETAIL, PRL - PRSNL, and PRLA - PRSNL_ALIAS.

field.description: SetID - Start at 1. Increment by 1.
Placer Order Number - By default, the interface sends the Cerner Millennium unique ORDER_ID.
Filler Order Number - The interface exposes a list of all order aliases associated with this order. PowerForm sends these values in reverse order
Universal Service ID
Priority - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Instead, use OBR-27.6
Requested Date/Time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Instead, use OBR-27.4

Observation Date/Time - Specimen Order: When specimen is collected. Radiology: Exam start date. Therapy or study: Performed date. Note: For MDOCs, if the EVENT_START_DT_TM is not populated, then the EVENT_END_DT_TM will be used.
Observation End Date/Time - Not valued for point- in-time services when begin and end date are identical. This is only populated for pass- through when no ORDER_ID exists.
Collection Volume - or lab tests, the collection volume is the volume of a specimen.
Collector Identifier - When a specimen is required for study, this field identifies the person, department, or facility that collected the specimen

Specimen Action Code - This identifies whether the result was a add-on order, the suggested values are A - Add order, G - Generated order or reflex order, L - Lab to obtain specimen from patient, O - Specimen obtained by service other than lab, P - Pending specimen, R - Revised order and S - Schedule. HL7 User table 0065.
Danger Code

Relevant Clinical Info - The interface sends appropriate order detail value associated with the order. Order detail may vary by Cerner Millennium catalog type, HNA activity type, or other format flex option.
Specimen Received Date/Time - n HL7 version 2.3, 2.3.1, and 2.4, this field is used to represent the specimen received DT. In HL7 version 2.5, this information is located in the SPM-18.

Specimen Source - In HL7 version 2.3, 2.3.1, and 2.4, this field is the site where the specimen was obtained or the service performed. All PathNet specimen orders will have a source defined. When PathNet is implemented, values returned from the PathNet script will override the order detail. In HL7 version 2.5 this informatio is now located in the SPM segment.

Ordering Provider - Valid personnel alias of type ORGDOC or other personnel alias defined for the target application. This information is the same in ORC-12 Ordering Provider, same layout as other type of provider/ doctor
Order Callback Phone Number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Placer Field 1
Placer Field 2 - Not supported by Cerner Millennium

Filler Field 1 - he interface provides as repeating instances of Value^ ValueType. HNA_ACCN identifiers the unformatted HNA accession. HNA_ACCNID identifies the internal row identifier of the accession table. The first occurrence will be HNA_ACCN and the second will be HNA_ACCNID. The comserver script will filter components and values not needed by the receiving system. In HL7 version 2.5.1, the HNA_ACCN will be sent in the SPM segment in the Filler field 2.2. and the HNA_ACCNID will not be sent outbound. Orders: When processing this will be set from the ACCESSION_ORDER_R table. Clinical Event: When no order is present this will be set from the CLINICAL_EVENT table. Helix: For PathNet Helix, the interface sends the Accession number from the CLINICAL_EVENT Table.
Filler Field 2

Results Rpt/Status Chng-Date/Time - The interface sends CLINSIG_UPDT_TM from the CLINICAL_EVENT table to specify the clinically significant date and time of the result that was reported or changed. In HL7 version 2.3, the system has a Routine Argument of OBR22_Verf to send CLINSIG_UPDT_DT_TM from the clinical event instead of ACTION_DT_TM. In HL7 version 2.3.1, the system sends the CLINSIG_UPDT_DT_TM from the Clinical event
Charge to Practice - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

Diagnostic Serv Sect ID - The interface sends an alias to Activity Type CD (Code Set 106) or Activity Subtype CD (Code Set 5801). Catalog Type CD (Code Set 6000) is not used for messages from Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0074.
Result Status - See discussion paragraphs for more information.
Parent Result - Used with Micro Susceptibility results. Also used to provide ordered procedure codes for supergroup, intervals and order sets.

Quantity/Timing - n HL7 version 2.3, 2.3.1, and 2.4 this field contains information about how many services to perform at one service time and how often the service times are repeated, and to fix duration of the request. In HL7 version 2.5, this information is now located in the TQ1 segment.
Result Copies To - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Parent - Used in Susceptibility results. Also used to provide parent order identifiers for supergroups, intervals, and order sets. This information is identical with ORC-8.
Transportation Mode - HL7 User Table 0124
Reason for Study
Principal Result Interpreter - RadNet: SIGN, VERIFY, or MODIFY. AP: SIGN, same layout as other type of provider/ doctor. HELIX: SIGN.
Assistant Result Interpreter - RadNet, AP: COSIGN, ASSIST, same layout as other type of provider/ doctor.

Technician - Transmitted with ORU Reports and with ORM status messages for non- specimen services. (such as Chest X-ray), same layout as other type of provider/ doctor. Not supported by Cerner Millennium with specimen orders.
Transcriptionist - RadNet: TRANSCRIBE.
Scheduled Date/Time - Date and time filler scheduled an observation.
Number of Sample Containers - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Transport Logistics of Collected Sample -Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Collectors Comment - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Transport Arrangement Responsibility - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Transport Arranged - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0224. A - Arranged, N - Not Arranged, and U - Unknown
Escort Required - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0225. R - Required, N - Not Required, U - Unknown.
Planned Patient Transport Comment - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Procedure Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Procedure Code Modifier - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Placer Supplemental Service Information- Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Filler Supplemental Service Information- Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Medically Necessary Duplicate Procedure Reason.- Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Result Handling - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Result Handling - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

segment.description: Timing/Quantity - The TQ1 segment is used to specify the complex timing of events and actions such as those that occur in order management and scheduling systems. This segment determines the quantity, frequency, priority, and timing of a service. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the TQ1 segment are OD - ORDER_DETAIL and CEPRL - CE_EVENT_PRSNL.

field.description: Set ID - TQ1 - Hardcode sequence
Quantity - This is hard coded to 1. The information is derived from OBR-27.1
Repeat Pattern - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User table 0335.
Explicit Time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User table 0335.
Relative Time and Units - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Service Duration - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Start Date/ Time - In previous HL7 versions this information is sent in OBR-27.4 Personnel action ORDER.
End Date/ Time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

Priority - This information came from OBR-27.6, HL7 User table 0485. This field describes the urgency of the request. If this field is blank, the default is R - routine. This field can repeat in HL7 - version 2.5.
Condition Text - In previous HL7 versions this information is sent in OBR-27.7
Text Instruction - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Conjunction - The system sends a value of C to indicate a second TQ1 segment is to follow.
Occurrence Duration - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Total Occurrences

segment.description: Observation/Result - The OBX segment is used to transmit a single observation or observation fragment. It represents the smallest indivisible unit of a report. Its principal mission is to carry information about observations in report messages. The OBX segment can also be part of an observation order (prompt). The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the OBX segment are CE - CLINICAL_EVENT, CEDT - CE_DATE, CEPRL - CE_EVENT_PRSNL, CEST - CE_STRING_RESULT, CEMB - CE_MICROBIOLOGY, CESUS - CE_SUSCEPTIBILITY, CV - CODE_VALUE, SR - SERVICE_RESOURCE and BLOB - CE_BLOB.

field.description: Set ID-OBX - Sequential under OBR. For compatibility with ASTM
Value type - Expected Values: ST, NM, FT, CE, DT, TX (charts) FT, ED, and CE are determined by the ESO format scripts. HL7 User Table 0125
Value type - Unique identifier for the observation. To send LOINC codes outbound, select the ESO Special Source flag at the contributor level and configure the alias processing accordingly

Observation sub-ID - Additional ID for results with same Observation ID, such as isolate ID, blood bank unit number). 1 or null for each new detail result. Multiple OBX with same type (OBX-2), identifier (OBX-3) and sub-id (OBX-4) treated as a unit. Routine argument OBX_4=1 to set this to task_assay_cd. Routine argument OBX_4=2 to set this to event_id. Routine argument OBX_4=3 to value the sub-id with a numeric value when a grouping is involved. Routine argument OBX_4=4 to set the sub-id with the original observation value type from OBX-2

Observation value - Actual observed results of Value type = OBX-2. Table and column varies by type and service area. Susceptibility results may have interpretation in OBX-8 but have no actual result value . May repeat for CE and FT. When sending attachments, the interface uses an ED data type to place the attachment in this field
Units

Reference ranges - Universal Interface extension: format range as | low- high^low^high For example, | 35-80^35^80 | In HL7 version 2.31, The interface sends the Reference Range in field 7.1 Range field. In HL7 version 2.3.1, The interface can use a routine argument of REF_RANGE to break up the Reference Range into OBX-7.2 low and OBX-7.3 high

Abnormal flags - For Genlab processing this will be populated from the NORMALCY_CD For Micro processing this will be populated from the RESULT_CD. Repeat only for susceptibilities. HL7 User Table 0078.
Abnormal flags - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Nature of abnormal test - HL7 User Table 0080

Observation result status - Valid values from HL7 User Table 0085: I - Specimen in Lab, Results Pending P - Preliminary R - Transcribed or results entered; Not Verified S - Partial results F - Verified result or final report C - Corrected D - Delete this OBX U Status change to final Defaults to parent record_status_cd
Date last obs normal values - Effective date and time for reference range in this OBX.
User defined access checks - Code value alias for ATTACHMENT on Code Set 18089
Date/time of the observation - Actual verification date/ time. Not provided for accession or order level display results or other observations with no associated verify personnel or time.
Producers ID - Composite field. Use when service performed by organization other than sending facility (for example, results performed at a reference laboratory).

Responsible observer - Observer verifying results. With ACTION_TYPE_CD of VERIFY. Not provided for accession or order level display results or other observations with no associated verify personnel or time, same layout as other type of provider/ doctor. This field can repeat in HL7 version 2.3.1. This field contains the identifier of the individual directly responsible for the observation

Observation method - The service resource is where the Performing lab observation occurred. The RESOURCE_CD can be used to access the SERVICE_RESOURCE table to pull the information in HL7 2.3 only. In HL7 2.4 this information is in OBX 15.2 and in HL7 2.5.1 the information is in OBX 23, 24 and 25
Equipment Instance Identifier - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Date/Time of the Analysis - This is the time stamp associated with the generation of the analytical result by the instrument.
Observation Site - Not supported by Cerner Millennium . Reserved for harmonization with HL7 version 2.6
Observation Instance Identifier - Not supported by Cerner Millennium . Reserved for harmonization with HL7 version 2.6
Mood code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium . Reserved for harmonization with HL7 version 2.6.
Performing Organization - This field cannot repeat in HL7 version 2.5.1.
Performing Organization Address - This field cannot repeat in HL7 version 2.5.1.
Performing Organization Medical Director - This field cannot repeat in HL7 version 2.5.1.

segment.description: Specimen - The SPM segment is used to describe the characteristics of a specimen. It differs from the intent of the OBR in that the OBR addresses order-specific information. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the SPM segment are AOR - ACCESSION_ORDER_R, CE - CLINICAL_EVENT, OD - ORDER_DETAIL and CECOL - CE_SPECIMEN_COLL.

field.description: Set ID - SPM
Specimen ID
Specimen Parent IDs - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Specimen Type
Specimen Type Modifier - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Specimen Additives - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Specimen Collection Method - The procedure or process by which the specimen was collected, formerly located in OBR-15.6
Specimen Source Site - Specifies the source from which the specimen was obtained. Values from SNOMED CT subset. Formerly located in OBR-15.4.
Specimen Source Site Modifier - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Specimen Collection Site - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Specimen Role - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Specimen Collection Amount - This field specifies the volume or mass of the collected specimen.
Grouped Specimen Count - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Specimen Description - Formerly located in OBR-15.3
Specimen Handling Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Specimen Risk Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Specimen Collection Date/ Time - The date and time when the specimen was acquired from the source, use to be in OBR-7.
Specimen Received Date/ Time - The time that the specimen was received at the diagnostic service, formerly located in OBR-14

segment.description: Document Endorsements - The ZDS segment is used to communicate document endorsement information (actions done or to be done) in Unsolicited Document Results (only PowerNote uses this segment). The ZDS Segment is optional and can occur after the OBR and the OBX. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the ZDS segment include: CEPRL - CE_EVENT_PRSNL

field.description: Action Code - Indicates the action which is/ will be completed. Example alias action type codes include A - Author, O - Order, T - Transcribe, V - Verify/ sign, C - Cosign, R - Review, CA - Cancel, correct, start administration, stop administration, or insert, review.
Clinical Staff - Indicates code and name of person responsible for performing the specified action.
Action Date and Time - Date and time action completed or should be completed by
Action Status - Not user- extendible. Resultant status of the action. Example alias codes include E - Expected/ requested and C - Completed.
Action Priority Code - Priority of expected action
Requesting Clinical Staff - Code and name of clinical staff who requested that the action be completed.
Action Comment - Comment or annotation describing the reason for the action or its status.
Proxy Person Personnel ID of the person who carried out the action on behalf of the ACTION_PRSNL_ID.

segment.description: Blood Product Unit - The Cerner-defined ZBP Blood Product Unit Segment is used to communicate blood product unit information that can be posted to the CLINICAL EVENT tables. The ZBP segment also is required to post blood bank patient-product events (such as Cross-Matched or Transfused). The ZBP segment occurs after an OBR segment and can occur after OBX segments containing non-product related blood bank results. During real-time Blood Bank result processing, the ZBP segment must occur immediately before an OBX segment containing a result or event associated with this product. The ZBP segment can repeat. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the ZBP segment are BBHP - BBHIST_PRODUCT, CE - CLINICAL_EVENT, CEPR - CE_PRODUCT and CEPA - CE_PRODUCT_ANTIGEN, ORG - ORGANIZATION AND ORGA - ORGANIZATION_ALIAS

field.description: ZBP Set Id - Start at 1, increment by 1.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.

BPU Unit or Lot Number -Combination of unit number, subunit number, and product uniquely identifies a blood product unit. When product is a manufactured product, number will be the product's lot number.
BPU Sub Unit Number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium; will be sent as part of the unit or lot number
BPU Product - Blood product code.
BPU Status - Alias to product status (Transfused, Returned, Cross- Matched).
BPU Event Date and Time - Date and time the event occurred.
BPU Expire Date and Time - Not used for transfused return or cross- match events.
BPU ABO - ABO codes
BPU RH - RH codes.
BPU Antigen - Antigen Code, Special Testing Code Value (Code Set 1612). Multiple instances allowed.
BPU Attributes - Attribute Code, Special Testing Code Value (Code Set 1612) whose CDF meaning is SPTYP. Multiple instances allowed. These will be identified on the CEPA by an attribute_ind of 1
BPU Supplier
Directed Indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Autologous Indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Donated by Relative Ind - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Pooled Product Indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Original Volume - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Original Volume (mL).
Assumed Transfused Volume - Total assumed transfused volume. The volume of the product tested.
Assumed Transfused Total International Units - Total assumed transfused international units. The concentration of the product. Used only with derivatives
Assumed Transfused Quantity - Total assumed transfused quantity or vials. The number of products tested. Used only with derivatives.
BPU Supplier Prefix - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Volume Units of measure - The unit of the volume for the product tested

ISBT Flag Characters - The flag characters are used to convey specific information other than the unique identification of the product. The three provided types of flag characters represent process control (with ISBT 128- defined meaning), process control (with a local blood center- defined meaning), or data transmission check

Product Number Format - This field needs to be populated with an identifier for the format of the value sent in ZBP-3- unit or lot number. This will allow the ability to distinguish between non- ISBT units and ISBT units
Quantity Units of measure - The unit of the number of products tested, such as bag, unit, vials, and so on
Strength Units of measure - The unit of the concentration of the product.

segment.description: Cerner Defined Segment. Follows AL1 Segment.

field.description: BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.
BPU Unique Identifier - Not used for transfused/ return or crossmatch events.

segment.description: Event Type - The EVN segments communicate the event trigger information to the receiving application. The supported ADT events were described previously and are from the HL7 Event Type Code Table 0003. This segment is required for all ADT messages. The Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the EVN segment are PRLA -PRSNL_ALIAS and EPRLR - ENCNTR_PRSNL_RELTN.

field.description: Event type code - Three- character EVENT code that "triggered" the message. Same as MSH-9.2.

Recorded date/time - Cerner Millennium: Transaction date and time of event sent from triggering program in the Cerner section of the ESO trigger. HL7: The triggering system's date and time that the event is recorded to have taken place. Valued by sending system. Default time stamp
Date/time planned event - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7: If valued, used for effective date and time for certain events.
Event reason code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Operator ID - The personnel alias of the personnel member who triggered the event
Event occurred - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. The date and time the event actually occurred.

segment.description: Patient Visit - Additional Information - The PV2 segment contains additional visit specific information to the information contained in PV1. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the PV2 segment include EN - ENCOUNTER, ELH - ENCNTR_LOC_HIST, and EAC - ENCNTR_ACCIDENT.

field.description: Prior pending location - Not supported by Cerner Millennium

Prior pending location - HL7 User Table 0129. Defines type of room based on number of beds (such as private, semi- private) and used for bed assignment, room billing, furnishings that are included or billed separately.
Admit reason - Cerner Millennium Applications accept free text only. Therefore the field is sent out as the second component: | ^reason for admission |
Transfer reason - Valued for A02 transactions only.
Patient valuables - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Patient valuables location - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Visit user code - HL7 User Table 0130.
Expected admit date/time - For pre- registered patients, future expected admit date.
Expected discharge date/time - Estimated date and time the patient that will depart (outpatient) or be discharged (inpatient) from the facility.
Estimated maximumLength of inpatient stay
Actual maximumLength of inpatient stay - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Visit description - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Free text reason for visit
Referral source code - Organization that made referral.
Previous service date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Employment illness related indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator. Y means job related illness.
Purge status code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0213.
Purge status date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Date on which data will be purged.

Special program code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0214. Designates specific health insurance program required for reimbursement. For example, Family Planning, Child Health Assistance
Retention indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 Table 0136 - Yes/No Indicator.
Expected number of insurance plans - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Number of insurance plans providing coverage for visit.
Visit publicity code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0215.
Visit protection indicator
Clinic organization name
Patient status code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0216
Visit priority code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium HL7 User Table 0217.
Previous treatment date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Expected discharge disposition - Interface values expected discharge disposition on pending discharge transactions.
Signature on file date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Date signature obtained for insurance billing purposes.
First similar illness date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Determine if patient had pre- existing condition.
Patient charge adjustment code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0218. Same as GT1-28.
Recurring service code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0219. Determines if treatment is continuous.
Billing media code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 table 0136.
Expected surgery date and time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Military partnership code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 table 0136. Military facility contracted with non- military facility.
Military non-availability code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 table 0136. Permission to use non- military facility.
Newborn baby indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 table 0136 - Y/N Indicator.
Baby detained indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 table 0136. Baby detained after mother's discharged.
Mode Of Arrival Code - Not used
Recreational Drug Use Code - Not used
Admission level of care code - Not used
Precaution Code - Not used
Patient Condition Code - Not used
Living Will Code - Not used
Organ Donor Code - Not used
Advanced Directive Code - Not used
Patient Status Effective Date - Not used
Expected LOA Return Date Time - Not used

segment.description: Next of Kin - The NK1 segment contains information about the patients other related parties. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the NK1 segment include AD - ADDRESS, EPR - ENCNTR_PERSON_RELTN, PH - PHONE, P - PERSON, PA - PERSON_ALIAS, PN - PERSON_NAME, PPR - PERSON_PERSON_RELTN, POR - PERSON_ORG_RELTN, and PP - PERSON_PATIENT.

field.description: Set ID - NK1 - Start at 1, increment by 1.
Name - The interface sends NAME from PERSON_NAME table whose type is CURRENT.

Relationship - HL7 User Table 0063. Relationship of the NK1 person to the patient. PPR.related_person_reltn_cd represents inverse relationship (patient to this NK1 person). This inverse relationship is currently passed in ZKI-2
Address - The interface sends the address with the Address type of HOME.
Phone number - Phone numbers of the following types can be sent out in this field: Home Phone, Alternate Pager, Personal Pager, Previous Pager, and Temporary Pager
Business phone number - Phone Numbers of the following types can be sent out in this field: Business Phone, Business Pager
Contact role - HL7 User Table 131. Valid Cerner Millennium values include NOK - Next of Kin, EMC - Emergency Contact, SPOUSE - spouse, EMPLOYER - Employer
Start date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
End date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Next of kin/AP job title - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Next of kin/AP job code/class
Next of kin/AP employee number
Organization name - NK1 - HL7 defines use in cases where employer serves as next of kin OR name of organization where next of kin works
Marital status - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0002
Sex - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 Table 0001
Date/time of birth
Living dependency - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0223.
Ambulatory status - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0009
Citizenship - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0171.
Primary language - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0296
Living arrangement - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0220
Publicity code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0215.
Publicity code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0136.
Student indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0231.
Religion - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0006.
Mother maiden name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Nationality - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0212.
Ethnic group - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0189.
Contact reason - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0222.
Contact person name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Contact person telephone number - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Contact person address - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Next of kin/AP identifiers
Job status - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 user Table 0311.
Race - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0005.
Handicap - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0295.
Contact person social security #Handicap - Not supported by Cerner Millennium

segment.description: Merge Patient Information - The MRG segment provides the receiving applications with information necessary to merge person, patient, account, or visit records. For the sending system, MRG identifiers represent prior identifiers after the event triggering this ADT message was completed. For the receiving system, MRG identifiers represent current identifiers before the ADT message has been processed. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the MRG segment include EA - ENCNTR_ALIAS, PA - PERSON_ALIAS, and PN - PERSON_NAME.

field.description: Prior patient identifier list - Person alias of the alias entity type MRN
Prior alternate patient ID - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Prior patient account number - Encounter alias of the alias entity type FINNBR
Prior patient ID - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Encounter Alias with a CD meaning of MRN
Prior visit number - Encounter alias of the alias entity type VISIT NBR
Prior alternate visit ID - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Prior patient name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

segment.description: Accident Information - The ACC segment contains patient accident information. The interface can send repeating ACC segments. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the ACC segment include EAC - ENCNTR_ACCIDENT

field.description: Accident date/ time
Accident Code - HL7 User Table 0050
Accident Location
Auto Accident State - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Accident Job Related Ind - HL7 Table 0136. Yes/No Indicator
Accident Death Indicator - HL7 Table 0136. Yes/No Indicator

segment.description: Patient Allergy Information Segment - The AL1 segment contains patient allergy information of various types. Each AL1 describes a single patient allergy Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the AL1 segment include ALL - ALLERGY, REACT - REACTION, and NOM - NOMENCLATURE.

field.description: Set ID - AL1 - Start at 1. Increment sequentially.
Allergen Type Code - HL7 User Table 0127 such as FA= Food Allergy
Allergen Code/Mnemonic/Description - Used to identify coded or free text allergy. For documentation, both code and description will be transmitted as stored on the ALLERGY table.
Allergy Severity Code - HL7 User Table 0128 such as SV - Severe

Allergy Reaction Code - For coded reactions, value SOURCE_IDENTIFIER from the NOMENCLATURE table. For free- text reactions value will be reaction_ftdesc from the REACTION table. There can be multiple reactions for a single allergy.
Identification Date

segment.description: Diagnosis Segment - The DG1 segment contains patient diagnosis information of various types. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the DG1 segment include DIAG - DIAGNOSIS, NOM - NOMENCLATURE, and DRG - DRG

field.description: Set ID - DG1 - Sequence number that identifies segment within message.

Diagnosis Coding Method - L7 User Table 0053 such as ICD9. HL7 2.3 recommends use of DG1-3 coding system component Coded diagnosis must be unique within a principle type (Code Set 401) and source vocabulary (Code Set 400). Principle type for DG1 is a code value whose meaning is DIAG. Value is a CDF meaning of SOURCE_VOCABULARY_
Diagnosis Code - DG1 - HL7 User Table 0051.
Diagnosis Description - Free- text diagnosis is not currently supported for ADT transactions.
Diagnosis Date/Time
Diagnosis Type - HL7 User Table 0052, such as admit, discharge, final.
Major Diagnostic Category - HL7 User Table 0118. Retained in HL7 2.3 for backward compatibility. MDC is a master file attribute
Diagnostic Related Group - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0055. In HL7 2.3, use new DRG segment.
DRG Approval Indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. In HL7 2.3, use new DRG segment.
DRG Grouper Review Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0056. In HL7 2.3, use DRG segment.
Outlier Type - HL7 User Table 0083. In HL7 2.3, use new DRG segment. Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Outlier Days - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. In HL7 2.3, use new DRG segment.
Outlier Cost - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. In HL7 2.3, use new DRG segment
Grouper Version And Type - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. In HL7 2.3, use new DRG segment.
Diagnosis Priority - 1- primary; 2- secondary.
Diagnosing Clinician

Diagnosis Classification - HL7 User Table 0228. HL7 suggested values: C - Consultation, D - Diagnosis, M - Medication, O - Other, R - Radiologic scheduling, S - Sign and symptom, T - Tissue diagnosis, and I - Invasive procedure
Confidential Indicator - HL7 Table 0136 Yes/No Indicator. DRG contains confidential diagnosis.
Attestation Date/Time - Date and time attestation was signed
Diagnosis Identifier
Diagnosis Action Code
Parent Diagnosis
DRG CCL Value Code
DRG Grouping Usage
DRG Diagnosis Determination St
Present On Admission (POA) Ind

segment.description: Guarantor - The GT1 segment contains guarantor (such as a person with financial responsibility for payment of a patient account) data for patient and insurance billing applications. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the GT1 segment include AD - Address, EOR - ENCNTR_ORG_RELTN, EPR - ENCNTR_PERSON_RELTN, O - ORGANIZATION, OA - Organization, PH - PHONE, P - PERSON, PA - PERSON_ALIAS, PN - PERSON_NAME, POR - PERSON_ORG_RELTN, and PP - PERSON_PATIENT.

field.description: Set Id - Guarantor - Starts at 1 and increments sequentially. . .
Guarantor Number - If Guarantor is a person , this field is one instance of a PERSON_ALIAS of the type MRN

Guarant Name - If the Guarantor is a person, these are the name components from the PERSON_NAME table with the NAME_TYPE_CD of CURRENT. If the Guarantor is an organization, Family Name is ft_org_name from the ENCNTR_ORG_RELTN table.
Guarantor spouse Name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

Guarantor address - When the Guarantor is a person, this field is addresses of the type: HOME, ALT or EMAIL. The PARENT_ENTITY_ID on the ADDRESS table is the PERSON_ID of the Guarantor. When the Guarantor is an organization, this field is the address on the ADDRESS table where the PARENT_ENTITY_ID is the ORGANIZATION_ID.
Guarantor Phone # - Home - If the Guarantor is a person, this field is the phone number with the phone type of HOME. Field not valued if Guarantor is an organization.
Guarantor Phone # - Bus - If Guarantor is a person, this field is the phone number with the phone type of BUSINESS.
Guarantor date of birth - Field not valued if Guarantor is organization
Guarantor Sex - Field not valued if Guarantor is an organization. HL7 Table 0001
Guarantor Type - HL7 User Table 0068
Guarantor Relationship - HL7 User Table 0063. Relationship of Guarantor to Patient. Cerner Millennium can pass the Relationship of Patient to Guarantor in the optional ZGI segment, field 3
Guarantor SSN - SSN of the Guarantor. This field not valued if Guarantor is an organization
Guarantor Date - Begin - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. The date the guarantor becomes responsible for the account.
Guarantor Date - End - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. The date the guarantor stops being responsible for the account.
Guarantor Priority - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. The order in which guarantors are responsible for the bill.
Guarantor Employer Name - The guarantor's employer is identified as the row on the PERSON_ORG_RELTN table where the PERSON_ORG_RELTN_CD is EMPLOYER and the priority_seq is either 0 or 1.
Guarantor Employer Address - The address row for the employer has a PARENT_ENTITY_ID equal to the PERSON_ORG_RELTN_ID.
The PHONE row for the employer has a PARENT_ENTITY_ID equal to the PERSON_ORG_RELTN_ID
Guarantor Employee ID #
Guarantor Employment Status - HL7 User Table 0066

Guarantor Organization name ^ name type ^ identifier ^ check digit ^ check scheme ^ assign auth ^ id type ^ assign fac - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Name and code of the guarantor when the guarantor is an organization.
Guar Billing Hold Flag - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 Table 0136 Yes/No Indicator.
Guar Credit Rating Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0218.
Guar Death Date / Time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Guar Death Ind - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 Table 0136 Yes/No Indicator.
Guar Chg Adjustmnt Cd - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 218.
Guar House Annual Incom - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Guar Household Size - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Guar Household Size - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Guar Marital Status Cd - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0002.
Guar Hire Effective Date
Employment Stop Date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0223.
Ambulatory Status - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0009
Citizenship - Not supported by Millennium. HL7 User Table 0171
Primary Language - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0296.
Living Arrangement - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0220
Publicity Indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0215
Protection Indicator - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0136.

Mothers Maiden Name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Mothers Maiden Name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Ethnic Group - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0189.
Contact Person Name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. This field contains the person to contact regarding guarantor bills
Contact Person Phone - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Contact Reason - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0222.
Contact Relationship - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0063. Guarantor relationship to contact person.
Job Title - ield is populated with EMPL_TITLE if valued. Otherwise, field is populated with EMPL_OCCUPATION_TEXT.
Job Code^Class - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0327/0328.
Guar Employer Org Name - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Handicap - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0310. Guarantor's disability
Handicap - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0310. Guarantor's disability

Guarantor Birth Place

segment.description: Insurance Information - The IN1 segment contains insurance policy coverage information necessary to produce pro-rated patient and insurance bills. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the IN1 segment include AD - ADDRESS, AUTH - AUTHORIZATION, EPR - ENCNTR_PERSON_RELTN, EPLR - ENCNTR_PLAN_RELTN, HP - HEALTH_PLAN, O - ORGANIZATION, P - PERSON, PN - PERSON_NAME, POR - PERSON_ORG_RELTN, PPLR - PERSON_PLAN_RELTN, and PH - PHONE.

field.description: Set ID Insurance
Insurance Plan ID - HL7 User Table 0072. Unique identifier for the insurance plan.
Insurance Company ID identifier ^ check dig ^ check scheme ^ assign auth ^ type assign fac - Unique identifier for the insurance company.
Insurance Comp Name name ^ name type ^ identifier ^ check dig ^ check scheme ^ assign auth ^ identifier type ^ assign fac
Insurance Comp Address
Insurnc Comp Contact Person - Contact for this plan
Insurance Comp Phone Nbr
Group Number - This field identifies the group associated with this plan. An insurance company can use either IN1-8, IN1-9, or both.
Group Name - This field identifies the group associated with this plan. An insurance company can use either IN1-8 or IN1-9 or both.
Insured's Group Employer ID - This is the unique Identifier for the employer associated with this group.
Insured's Group Employer Name - This is the name of the employer associated with this group. If IN1-10 Insureds Group Employer ID is not valued, the interface creates a free text organization
Plan effective date
Plan Expiration Date
Authorization Information auth #^date^source - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. Authorization from insurance company prior to non- emergency admissions and within 48 hours of emergency admissions.
Plan Type - HL7 User Table 0086 (such as Medicare, Medicaid, HMO, Self Pay, Blue Shield, POS, PPO, PP, COMMERCIAL).
Name of Insured
Insured's Relationship to Pat
Insured's Date of Birth
Insured's Address
Assignment of Benefits - HL7 User Table 0135. Determines whether the insured agreed to assign benefits to the provider. HL7 suggested values include Y, N, M - modified.

Coordination of Benefits - Not supported by Cerner Millennium. HL7 User Table 0173. Determines whether this insurance works in conjunction with or independent of other insurances such as CO- Coordinate; IN- Independent.
Coordination of Benefits Prior
Notice of Admission Code - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

segment.description: UB92 Data - The UB2 segment contains data necessary to complete UB92 bills. Only UB92 data elements that do not exist in other HL7 defined segments appear in this segment. Just as with UB82 billing, Patient Name and Date of Birth are required for UB92 billing; however, they are included in the PID segment and therefore do not appear here. Where the field locators are different on the UB92, when compared to the UB82, the element is listed with its new location in parentheses (). Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the UB2 segment include ECC - ENCNTR_CONDITION_CODE, EVC - ENCTR_VALUE_CODE, EOC - ENCNTR_OCCURRENCE_CODE, and ESC - ENCNTR_SPAN_CODE.

segment.description: Person Employment Information - The ZEI segment contains person employment information. When an attribute is listed twice, as both free text string and as a composite field with code and text components (such as ZEI-3 and ZEI-11) the interface uses the composite field. The optional ZEI segment can occur after the PID or ZPI segment in an ADT message. The interface supports only one optional ZEI segment. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the ZEI segment include AD - ADDRESS, PH - PHONE, O - ORGANIZATION, and POR - PERSON_ORG_RELTN.

segment.description: Pharmacy Administration - The RXA segment is used to capture the immunization specific information. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the RXA segment include CE - CLINICAL_EVENT, CEMED - CE_MED_RESULT, V500 - V500_EVENT_SET, CENT - CE_EVENT_NOTE, LTXT - LONG_TEXT, and HMEXP - HM_EXPECT_MOD.

field.description: Give Sub-ID Counter - Not supported by Cerner Millennium

Administration Sub-ID Counter CE - This field is used to identify the dose number of the immunization. Upon viewing the immunizations, the health maintenance server will calculate this value if not sent. The interface sends RXA-02 if the CLINICAL_EVENT.CLINICAL_SEQUENCE is greater than 0 and the immunization is indicated to have been given. The interface sets RXA-02 to 0 if RXA-20 is valued as not done; it sets RXA-02 to 999 if the CLINICAL_EVENT.CLINICAL_SEQUENCE is equal to or less than 0.
Date/ Time Start of Administration - This field is used to identify the date/ time the immunization was administered. The interface sends a blank if the status is not given.
Date/ Time End of Administration - Not supported by Cerner Millennium

Administered Code - HL7 Table number 0292. This will be the immunization code or product. If no code exists, then a description must be sent in 5.2 and this will be used to AOF and EVENT_CD to be reconciled by the client.
Administered Amount
Administered Units - The interface does not send this field if the immunization is not given.
Administered Dosage Form - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

Administration Notes - This field is retained for backward compatibility. For the new Immunizations model, administration notes will be sent in the ZNT segment. Note: This will be sent in the second component

Administration Provider - A row must be configured in the Personnel Alias tab of SI Manager or the ESI Configuration Tool. ESI uses the ESI Alias Field Code of All Personnel. If the personnel is not found, ESI will insert the default personnel for the feed.This is the person who performed or administered the immunization.
Administered- at Location - The location is sent in 11.9 as a free text value.The interface uses a NOTE_TYPE_CD where the CDF Meaning is LOCATION HIST
Administered per (Time Unit) - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Administered Strength - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Administered Strength - Not supported by Cerner Millennium
Substance Lot Number
Substance Expiration Date
Substance Manufacturer Name - HL7 Table 0227.

Substance Refusal Reason - The 1st component should be populated with a coded refusal reason, with the 2nd component used for free- text.Possible values: Refused - Do Not Give, Contraindicated - Do Not Give, Unnecessary
Indication - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

Completion Status - If the value of MODIFIER_TYPE_CD on the HM_EXPECT_MOD table is REFUSED, then the interface sends REFUSED. The interface uses the routine argument Set RXA-20 From Modifier Type Code.
Action Code- RXA - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
System Entry Date/ Time - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.

segment.description: Immunization Information - The Cerner standard ZVX Immunization information is used to communicate vaccine information. This segment applies only to message transmitted from PowerChart or PowerChart Office for immunizations. The ZVX segment is sent on all immunization messages. The ZVX segment occur at the end of the message. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the ZVX segment are CE - CLINICAL_EVENT, CENT - CE_EVENT_NOTE, IM - IMMUNIZATION_MODIFIERS, and HMEXP - HM_EXPECT_MOD

field.description: ZVX Set ID - The field is hard coded to 1 and does not increment.
Contraindication description - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
VFC Status - This tells what type of patient was given the vaccine. Examples include Medicaid, patients insurance covers it, patient has no insurance, American Indian, and so on

VIS Date/ time - This is the version date of the information sheet for vaccines given to the parent or guardian for the vaccine in the RXA segment. If multiple VIS Date/ times, they need to be sent in ZVX-11. If using ZVX-11, do NOT send anything in this field.The full date must be sent
History Source - This is where/ who provided the vaccination history information (for example, mother, father, self, immunization record, clinician, social worker, and so on).

Patient Tolerance/ Reaction - This field is used to capture the tolerance and or reaction to the immunization (such as, baby had 101 degree fever).Will use a NOTE_TYPE_CD where the CDF Meaning is PATTOLERANCE.
Immunization Type - Defines the type of immunization (pediatric, adult, travel)
Refusal/ Deferral Person - This is the person entering the refusal or the authorizing person for the deferral.
Deferral to Date/ Time - This is the deferred to date/ time. If this is a refusal, this can be populated with the date/ time the immunization was refused.

Vaccine Component - This field will be used with ZVX-11 to capture multiple VIS Date/ Time when multiples are associated with an immunization.This field will need to contain the EVENT_CD alias for the vaccine component (for example, for a HIB- HepB, this field should contain, HIB~HepB)This field must be populated if sending VIS date/ times in ZVX-11.

Vaccine Component VIS Date/ Time - This field will be used with ZVX-10 to capture multiple VIS Date/ Time when multiples are associated with an immunization. The full date must be sent - This is to identify the reason sent in RXA-18 as an expire reason.If a reason is sent in RXA-18, this field must be populated.
Refusal/ Deferral Type

segment.description: Additional Comments - The ZNT segment will be used to provide additional comments. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the ZNT segment: CENT - CE_EVENT_NOTE.

field.description: ZNT Set Id - Increments with each Z segment starting with 1

Date - Not supported by Cerner Millennium.
Comment - Cerner Millennium accepts notes up to 32K. The interface converts ZNT-04 to ASCII if it is RTF

segment.description: Problem Detail Segment - The problem detail segment contains the data necessary to add, update, correct and delete the problems of a given individual. Cerner Millennium tables referenced from the PRB segment: NOM - NOMENCLATURE; PRB - PROBLEM; PRBD - PROBLEM_DISCIPLINE

field.description: Action Code - HL7 table 0287. Contains the intent of action associated with this segment. Valid HL7 action codes: AD, CO, DE, LI, UC, UN, UP Valid Cerner Millennium actions: AD, DE, UP
Action Date/ Time - Use of this date and time varies with the action code
Problem ID - HL7: Identification of the problem from the master list of problems. Cerner Millennium : Nomenclature row for this code and source.

Problem Instance ID Entity id^namespace id^universal id^univ id type - Not supported. HL7: Unique identifier. Remains unique over time. Identifies a specific instance for a specific patient and unique across all patients. For problems added by Cerner Millennium , the PROBLEM_ID uniquely identifies a problem; each change or revision creates a new PROBLEM_INSTANCE
Episode of Care ID - Not supported.
Problem List Priority - Not supported.
Problem Established Date - The date and time when the problem was initially identified by the care giver.
Anticipated problem resolution date and time - The estimated date the problem will be resolved.
Actual problem resolution date and time - The date and time the problem was actually resolved.
Prb Classification - Identifies the kind of problem. Used to categorize the problem so that it may be managed and viewed independently within different applications.

Prb Management Discipline - Category of care providers that have responsibility for managing this specific problem. Cerner meanings include: CARETEAM, NURSING, PHYSICIAN, THERAPIST. Cerner accepts multiple instances processed as a group to identify all disciplines who may have the responsibility for this problem.
Problem Persistence - Indicates the perseverance of a problem. (e.g., acute, chronic)
Problem Confirmation Status - ndicates the verification status of a problem. Cerner meanings include: CONFIRMED, DIFFERENTIAL, PROVISIONAL
Problem Life Cycle Status - Current status of the problem. Cerner meanings include: ACTIVE, CANCELED, INACTIVE, RESOLVED.
Problem Life Cycle Status Date and Time - The effective date and time of the life cycle status code
Problem Date of Onset - The date and time the problem began.
Problem Onset Text - Not used
Problem Ranking - A user defined prioritization of the problem. No Cerner meanings. (for example: primary, secondary)
Certainty of Problem - Contains a qualitative representation of the problem. User defined. (for example: high, low, medium). Alternate approach to probability

Probability of problem (0-1) - Contains a quantitative or numeric representation of the certainty of the problem Alternate approach to CERTAINTY_CD. For example, .75 implies a 75% probability that the problem was correctly identified.
Individual Awareness of problem - Identifies persons comprehension of the problem. (for example: full, marginal, partial)
Problem Prognosis - Contains prognosis for the problem. (for example: fair, good, poor).
Individual Awareness of problem prognosis - Identifies persons comprehension of the problem.
Family/ Sig Other awareness of problem/ prognosis - dentifies family's comprehension of the problem. HL7 defines as ST; Cerner will process as an IS.
Security/ Sensitivity - Not supported.

segment.description: Query Instances
Goal Detail Segment - The goal detail segment contains the data necessary to add, update, correct, and delete the goals for an individual.

field.description: Action code - The action code field gives the intent of the problem or goal. Refer to HL7 table 0287 Problem/goal action code for valid values.
Action Date/Time - This field contains the date/time that the operation represented by the action code was performed.
Goal ID -This field identifies the goal. This is the identifier from an institutions master list of goals.
Goal Instance ID -This field contains the unique identifier assigned by an initiating system to this instance of the goal.
Episode of Care ID -This field uniquely identifies the episode of care to which this goal applies. See note under Ongoing issues.
Goal List Priority -This field prioritizes this goal on a list that is maintained for an individual.
Goal Established Date/Time -This field identifies the date/time when the stated goal was initially created.
Expected Goal Achieve Date/Time -This field contains the projected date/time for achieving the stated goal.

Goal Classification -This field indicates the kind of goal. This field can be used to categorize goals so that they may be managed and viewed independently within different applications e.g., admission, final, post-operative, pre-operative, outpatient, discharge, etc.

Goal Management Discipline -This field indicates the category of caregiver with responsibility for managing this specific goal e.g., care team, nursing, medicine, respiratory therapy, occupational therapy, dietary etc. This is a repeating field to allow identification of all disciplines that may have the responsibility for this goal.
Current Goal Review Status -This field contains the current point in the continuum of a goal review cycle e.g., due, initiated, reviewed, overdue, verified, etc.
Current Goal Review Date/Time -This field contains the date/time of the current review of the goal.
Next Goal Review Date/Time -This field contains the date/time of the next scheduled goal review.
Previous Goal Review Date/Time -This field contains the date/time that the goal was reviewed prior to the current review.
Goal Review Interval -This field contains the interval used to calculate the next goal review date.
Goal Evaluation-This field provides an indicator of progress towards achievement of the goal e.g., achieved, ahead of schedule, delayed, failed to achieve, etc.

Goal Evaluation Comment-This field contains the comments associated with the goal evaluation. Examples of comments that might be entered in this field include: a reason for delay in achieving goal, or a clinical footnote about progress made towards the goal, etc.
Goal Life Cycle Status-This field contains an indication of the state of the goal e.g., Active, Canceled, Inactive, Suspended, etc.
Goal Life Cycle Status Date/Time -This field contains the effective date/time of the current goal life cycle status.
Goal Target Type -This field contains the individual/group for whom the goal has been established e.g., family group, family member, patient, etc.
Goal Target Name -This field contains the identification of the person on whom the goal is focused. This is a repeating field which allows for the identification of a group of individuals

segment.description: The ZBX (Additional Appointment Information) segment is used to transmit a single attribute or schedule detail not mapped to a standard HL7 Scheduling segment but associated with a schedule event or action. The data element can be a Cerner-defined or user-defined detail. Details associated with a schedule 23/25 The version of the page that you are viewing is a draft version and should not be treated as if it were official content. Copyright Cerner Corporation. All right reserved. The referenced page contains confidential and or proprietary information which may not be reproduced or transmitted without the express written consent of Cerner. The referenced page will be retained indefinitely. All non-Cerner trademarks referenced herein are the property of their respective owners. vary with the appointment type and accept format used to capture information for the appointment type and action. A schedule detail can provide additional information to different levels of the schedule message: AIG (general resource level), AIL (location resource), AIP (personnel resource), AIS (service resource level), or SCH (schedule or appointment level). The ZBX segment is optional and repeating. If an optional NTE comment follows any SCH or AI* segment, the ZBX segments follow the NTE. If the NTE is not present, the ZBX immediately follows the SCH or AI* segment. The SCH or AI* segment immediately preceding the ZBX segment determines the attribute level. Each ZBX can be considered a name, value pair in which the OBX-3 contains the name and OBX-5 contains the value. The Cerner Millennium table referenced from the ZBX segment is SCHEVD - SCH_EVENT_DETAIL.
